column5: Bly and I went out last night to try our luck at night fishing again.  Bly pulled one out in the dark last week, so we figured it was possible to do so!  We found a nice spot and began our fishing.  It was very cold last night...flurries....and when the wind picked up it sent shivers down our spines.  Long story short...the steelies weren't hitting anything we put out there, but my adrenaline did get pumped for a short while.  My float went down and I set the hook and pulled in my very first sucker.    Had to take a picture of it...since it's my first.  I was a little disappointed to find that they are not one of the species for OFAH angler awards or the OFC Tourney...LOL  Anyhow, hopefully I'll try out my luck today or tomorrow.
Great for fertilizer or fish cake so I hear but not my cup of tea.

I've eaten them before.... they aren't bad except they have alot of tiny little bones in them that are IMPOSSIBLE to get out....heard if you score them every inch or so the oil will get in and dissolve the tiny bones but sure as poop we were pickin' bones out of our teeth all night!!!!  Congrats on the new species!  Cheers, UF
Wow, I'm impressed! To head out on such a cold blustery night......that's true dedication
I heard if you nail'em to a board and let it all sit for 30 days , the board doesn't taste too bad !! :D  Nice report !
Must have been a sucker weekend  I got one of those ugly suckers too.  Great report.  Joey
Saw your report too Joey...at least you caught some trout though!!! LOL.
Hey Cliff at least you didn't get skunked!  I thought pike had alot of slime on them this little sucker looks heavily coated in droll!ooooooooooooohhhhhhhhhhhh yuck.
suckers comin in good now!!! gonna be wastin alot of roe on them!!
Thanks for the report, and nice fish!
that is one ugly fish, oh well at least u didn't get skunked
